table.name: admin_users
table.description: A dummy user, till we work out the structure of user tables.

column.name: ms_param_size
column.description: count of the number of variables in the output array we need to feed to the GAUSS model. Probably never changes from the default

column.name: acceptable_running_time
column.description: flag and error if a model runs for longer than this (in seconds). Defaults to 1 hour

column.name: executable_file
column.description: The Exe file associated with this model

column.name: model_table_total_start_row
column.description: positions of row totals for race, etc. for each we have start row, start column.

column.name: model_table_total_start_col
column.description: positions of row totals for race, etc. for each we have start row, start column.

table.name: standard_user
table.description: A dummy user, till we work out the structure of user tables.

table.name: groups
table.description: A dummy group, till we work out the structure of user tables.

column.name: run_id
column.description: Unique indenfier for this run associated with this run

column.name: model_name
column.description: The model associated with this run

table.name: run_submission
table.description: a placeholder for a single run

column.name: run_id
column.description: Unique indenfier for this run associated with this run

column.name: model_name
column.description: The model associated with this run

column.name: queue_id
column.description: Use this to monitor job in the queue

column.name: run_state
column.description: Last known state of the run

column.name: all_calculation_iterations_complete
column.description: all the models except DIMMSIM are submitted once per run, but each year/iter in dimmsim is submitted seperately, so this signals that the last of them is done. So, default it to true and set to 0 if this is DIMMSIM

column.name: calculation_iterations_started
column.description: DIMMSIM is multiply submitted, so this helps tell where we are, even if the state is set to (say) queued after some chunk is submitted

column.name: num_nodes
column.description: Num physical machines we saw when we started

column.name: num_processors_per_node
column.description: FIXME assumes equal numbers per processor should be own table??

table.name: run_segment
table.description: The details of the run submitted to one machine.

column.name: run_id
column.description: Unique indenfier for this run associated with this run

column.name: model_name
column.description: The model associated with this run

column.name: queue_id
column.description: Use this to monitor job in the queue

column.name: command
column.description: command to be run on this processing segment

column.name: machine_name
column.description: machine this segment is running on

column.name: end_household
column.description: end household for this segment; null implies all available

table.name: segment_run_event
table.description: a monitored event for a run, from the pov of the machine doing the monitoring

column.name: run_id
column.description: Unique indenfier for this run associated with this run

column.name: model_name
column.description: The model associated with this run

column.name: year
column.description: If multi year. which year is being processed

column.name: submission_time
column.description: Original Submission Time for this segment

column.name: model_pid
column.description: Pid of the actual model run

column.name: monitor_pid
column.description: Pid of the php job that starts and monitors the model run

column.name: run_id
column.description: Unique indenfier for this run associated with this run

column.name: model_name
column.description: The model associated with this run

table.name: run_settings
table.description: Num Households, tolerances, etc. for a run

column.name: run_id
column.description: Unique indenfier for this run associated with this run

column.name: model_name
column.description: The model associated with this run

column.name: num_segments
column.description: How many slices we're chopping this up into for the run

column.name: start_year
column.description: Where to start, if this is a time-series model

column.name: end_year
column.description: Where to end, if this is a time-series model

column.name: run_id
column.description: Unique indenfier for this run associated with this run

column.name: model_name
column.description: The model associated with this run

column.name: year
column.description: Year this parameter refers to, or -99

table.name: model_output_tables
table.description: List of tables produced by a given model

column.name: variable
column.description: the table contents: for example, income tax, vat

column.name: vartype
column.description: whether the table represents budget or eligibility

column.name: run_id
column.description: Unique indenfier for this run associated with this run

column.name: model_name
column.description: The model associated with this run

column.name: raw_data
column.description: data as a VARCHAR, for performance reasons

table.name: input_page_detail
table.description: pick one of these up to help generate page contents. Assumes all the page content are contained in one ParameterSystem class and optionally pointed to by the contents of one enumerated type.

column.name: instance_path
column.description: path to the class through instances in a parameters2.dtd xml file

column.name: help_link
column.description: A url for the information pop-up for this page.

column.name: info_class_path
column.description: path to the class through classes in a parameters2.dtd xml file; will be different from class path for e.g. arrays. This will be the base and classpath will be the variables

column.name: class_path
column.description: path to the class through classes in a parameters2.dtd xml file

column.name: variables
column.description: delimited list of all the variables to be displayed on this page, or ALL in the class if none

column.name: enumerations
column.description: delimited list of all the enumerated values to be displayed on this page, or ALL if none

table.name: chart_specification
table.description: pick one of these up to help generate page contents. Assumes all the page content are contained in one ParameterSystem class and optionally pointed to by the contents of one enumerated type.

column.name: start_year
column.description: Where to start, if this is a time-series model

column.name: end_year
column.description: Where to end, if this is a time-series model

column.name: is_thumbnail
column.description: Where to end, if this is a time-series model

column.name: chart_type
column.description: For instance: bar, pie, time series

column.name: autogenerate
column.description: generate the chart during the run itself

table.name: model_table_offsets
table.description: Asghar's tabulators splurge out great rows of real numbers as strings, one each in the same format for each variable (income tax, vat and so on). Each tabulation contains crosstabs of the variable by (say) gender and race. The locations of each crosstab within each file is described in the spreadsheet ppresentation_of_outputs_-_Gini.xls. This just returns the position of each crosstab in any file, once it has been parsed into an array of reals.

column.name: run_id
column.description: Unique indenfier for this run associated with this run

column.name: model_name
column.description: The model associated with this run

column.name: lorenz_curve_points
column.description: points as a hack php array

column.name: run_id
column.description: Unique indenfier for this run associated with this run

column.name: model_name
column.description: The model associated with this run

table.name: macro_data_item
table.description: A single value for a variable for 1 year for a given user and saved dataset name

column.name: run_id
column.description: Unique indenfier for this run associated with this run

column.name: model_name
column.description: The model associated with this run

column.name: year
column.description: Year this parameter refers to, or -99

column.name: operation
column.description: S share, P pct change, L level

table.name: macro_output_buffer
table.description: everything blasted out by a single macro model run,, in raw form

column.name: run_id
column.description: Unique indenfier for this run associated with this run

column.name: model_name
column.description: The model associated with this run
